kanji_set.grammar_note: Crucial for dates and time. Note the rendaku (sound change) in 'bi' like in 'nichiyoubi'.

examples.japanese: 日曜日は友達と一緒に公園へ行って、ピクニックをします。
examples.romaji: Nichiyoubi wa tomodachi to issho ni kouen e itte, pikuniku o shimasu.
examples.english: On Sunday, I will go to the park with my friends and have a picnic.

examples.japanese: 日本のアニメは世界中でとても人気があって、面白いです。
examples.romaji: Nihon no anime wa sekaijuu de totemo ninki ga atte, omoshiroi desu.
examples.english: Japanese anime is very popular all over the world and is interesting.

examples.japanese: 誕生日のプレゼントに新しい本をもらって、とても嬉しかったです。
examples.romaji: Tanjoubi no purezento ni atarashii hon o moratte, totemo ureshikatta desu.
examples.english: I received a new book as a birthday present and was very happy.

examples.japanese: 毎日の生活の中で、日本語を練習することはとても大切だと思います。
examples.romaji: Mainichi no seikatsu no naka de, nihongo o renshuu suru koto wa totemo taisetsu da to omoimasu.
examples.english: I think practicing Japanese in daily life is very important.

examples.japanese: 今日は天気がいいので、窓から明るい日の光が入ってきます。
examples.romaji: Kyou wa tenki ga ii node, mado kara akarui hi no hikari ga haitte kimasu.
examples.english: Since the weather is good today, bright sunlight is coming through the window.
